model_answer: A: She begins by challenging the patience given to Frank despite others noting positives, and centers her argument on availability and four years of unclear contribution. As the debate heats up, on-screen chat messages back her (“Ashley goin in,” “FACTS ASH”), and she doubles down with sharp analogies. By the end, she concedes he might succeed elsewhere but insists it’s time to move on and that it likely won’t be in New York.

B: The panel explores both sides, noting instability such as multiple coaches and framing Frank as a multi-positional defender who might be re-signed cheaply. The show then explicitly invites an audience verdict, with on-screen prompts and a live chat ticker that sides with Ashley’s tougher position. The visual headers and call-in graphics underscore an interactive format that culminates in that audience-leaning outcome.
